channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Novel Phishing Attack Abuses Vercel and Telegram to Deliver RATs
item.description:
A novel phishing campaign, observed between November 2025 and January 2026, is abusing trusted `*.vercel.app` domains to bypass email security filters and deliver malware. The attack, detailed by Cloudflare, uses financial lures like fake invoices to trick victims into clicking. A unique feature is ...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Malware, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: New 'Sicarii Ransomware' RaaS Emerges, Targeting U.S. Manufacturing
item.description:
A new ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation named 'Sicarii Ransomware' has been discovered by researchers at CYFIRMA. Active since late 2025, the group is targeting the manufacturing sector in the United States. The malware encrypts victim files using AES-GCM and appends a '.sicarii' extension to...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Clop Ransomware Group Claims Attack on Canadian Helicopter Company
item.description:
The notorious Clop ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against CMHHELI.COM, a Canadian company. On January 29, 2026, the group added the company to its dark web leak site, threatening to publish stolen data if a ransom is not paid. This incident highlights the persistent an...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of Crunchbase, Betterment via Okta Vishing Attacks
item.description:
The notorious cyber extortion syndicate ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for breaching business intelligence firm Crunchbase and financial advisory company Betterment. According to the threat actor, the initial access was gained by using sophisticated voice phishing (vishing) attacks to socia...

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: ShinyHunters Claims Breach of 10M Match Group Users from Hinge & OkCupid
item.description:
The notorious cybercrime group ShinyHunters has claimed responsibility for a major data breach impacting Match Group, the parent company of popular dating apps like Hinge, OkCupid, and Match.com. The group posted on a dark web forum that it has stolen over 10 million user records, and released a 1.7...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Threat Actor, Supply Chain Attack

item.title: US Indicts 31 More in ATM Jackpotting Ring Linked to Tren de Aragua Gang
item.description:
A U.S. federal grand jury has indicted an additional 31 individuals for their participation in a widespread 'ATM jackpotting' conspiracy, bringing the total number of defendants to 87. The sophisticated scheme involved using malware to force ATMs to dispense large sums of cash. Many of the newly cha...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

item.title: Nova Ransomware Group Claims Cyberattack on KPMG Netherlands, Sets 10-Day Deadline
item.description:
The Nova ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against the Netherlands division of global professional services firm KPMG. The claim, which appeared on ransomware monitoring services on January 23, 2026, alleges that the group successfully breached KPMG's systems and exfiltra...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

item.title: Everest Ransomware Leaks Data of 72 Million Under Armour Customers After Failed Talks
item.description:
The Everest ransomware group has claimed a massive data breach against athletic apparel giant Under Armour. After negotiations allegedly failed, the group announced on its dark web leak site that it has published the full dataset, which it claims contains 191 million records, including 72.7 million ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Threat Actor

item.title: New 'Osiris' Ransomware Borrows TTPs from Medusa and Inc Gangs, Uses Signed Driver to Kill AV
item.description:
A new ransomware strain named Osiris is demonstrating a high level of sophistication by combining tactics from established ransomware groups like Medusa and Inc. The attackers use Rclone for data exfiltration to Wasabi cloud storage and deploy a version of Mimikatz named `kaz.exe`, both TTPs linked ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Malware, Threat Actor

item.title: Medusa Ransomware Exploits Cybersecurity Gaps, Escalating Attacks Across Africa
item.description:
Ransomware attacks are a pervasive and highly damaging threat across the African continent, where a significant cybersecurity skills and resources gap creates a fertile ground for cybercriminals. Notorious ransomware groups, including Medusa, are increasingly targeting organizations in the region, l...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack
